snippet: In announcing the forecast loss, the Japanese carrier joins other Dreamliner operators, like All Nippon Airways and United Airlines, in raising possible compensation demands.
abstract: Japan Airlines says grounding of its Boeing 787 Dreamliner fleet over battery problems will cost it 700 million yen ($7.5 million) in earnings through March 2013, and that it will seek compensation from Boeing; reports profit in first three fiscal quarters of 140.6 billion yen; revenue rose 3.6 percent to 942 billion yen.
lead_paragraph: In announcing the forecast loss, the Japanese carrier joins other Dreamliner operators, like All Nippon Airways and United Airlines, in raising possible compensation demands.

headline.seo: Japan Airlines Says Grounding 787 Will Cost $7.5 Million
headline.main: Japan Airlines Says 787 Grounding Will Cost It $7.5 Million
headline.print_headline: Airline Says 787 Woes Will Cost It $7.5 Million
